title: The Basics of Breathwork: Pranayama (Ayurvedic Breathing Meditation)
author: Shrankhla Holecek on
description: Breath is the absolute vital force of life. Ayurveda recognizes this importance and elevates it through Pranayama, the formal practice of controlled breathing, also referred to as breathwork. Pranayama can have a profound impact on the functioning of the nervous system and our overall state of being.

We cannot live if we cannot fill our lungs with nourishing air and feed our bodies essential oxygen. Ayurveda recognizes this importance and elevates it through Pranayama, the formal practice of controlled breathing, also referred to as breathwork. (The Prana represents life and consciousness.) Several simple but vital breathwork practices can be done anytime and any place. Ujjayi Pranayama (Victorious Breath) A soothing, calming, audible breath that involves inhaling and exhaling through the nose, while keeping the lips closed. The technique involves constricting the back of the throat, as one would while whispering. Inhaling normally, filling up the lungs, exhaling in short quick forceful bursts. This breath is great for balancing Kapha dosha. [Shitali](https://www.umaoils.com/blogs/uma-oils/breathe-like-a-yogi-best-pranayama-practices-for-your-dosha) Pranayama A cooling breath that involves inhalation through the tongue curled and exhaling slowly through the nose.
